conclusion: A certain mass of an ideal gas undergoes a state change represented on the p-V diagram.
Temperature at state A is -73°C, and the internal energy change from state A to C is 200 J.
Under standard conditions, 1 mole of an ideal gas occupies 22.4 L.
At state A, pressure p_A = 3 × 10^5 Pa and volume V_A = 1 × 10^-3 m³.

premise: Using the ideal gas law pV = nRT.

conclusion: From A to B, the process is isobaric (constant pressure).
From B to C, the process is isochoric (constant volume).

premise: Work done W_BC = 0 because there is no change in volume.
Total work done W_AC = W_AB + W_BC.
Using the first law of thermodynamics ΔU = Q - W.
